oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jim Carr Tub Mill
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A water-powered tub mill (a type of grist mill) is pictured, along with a man watching it operate. The mill is constructed of wood and is located next to a creek.

A grist mill is a place where grains are ground into flour. This grist mill was used by Tennessee pioneers and was located in Sugarlands above the headquarters of the Great Smoky Mountains National Park until destroyed by a flood in 1951.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mills; Grains; Flour & meal industry
